intro: Schistocarpha margaritensis, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering period occurs in late summer. Schistocarpha margaritensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
